thread.title: Clippers' Chris Paul fractures finger during practice, not considered serious
thread.title_full: Clippers' Chris Paul fractures finger during practice, not considered serious

author: Olive Garden kicked out cop because of duty gun
title: Clippers' Chris Paul fractures finger during practice, not considered serious
text:
Clippers' Chris Paul fractures finger during practice, not considered serious theScore 2 days ago © Gary A. Vasquez-USA TODAY Sports The Los Angeles Clippers appear to have dodged a bullet with an injury to perhaps the most important player on their roster.
AdChoices Point guard Chris Paul fractured his left index finger during Saturday's practice, the team announced . He won't suit up when the Clippers take on the Charlotte Hornets Sunday at Shenzhen Universiade Center in China.
The injury isn't considered serious, though. The eight-time All-Star will be re-evaluated prior to Wednesday's preseason matchup with Charlotte.
Paul likely would have competed in Shenzhen had it been a regular-season outing, sources tell the Orange County Register's Dan Woike .
In a full 82-game slate last season, Paul averaged a double-double of 19.1 points and 10.2 rebounds with a player efficiency rating of 26.
